DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Quality of Life Consent Knowledge Confirmation Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calendar date Investigator acknowledges understanding of a study patient's decision to withdraw consent from the Quality of Life portion of a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Quality of Life Consent Knowledge Confirmation Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify confirmation of the Investigator's understanding of a study participant's decision to withdraw consent from participation in the Quality of Life portion of a study._Having been established or verified._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: a researcher in a clinical trial or clinical study.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Property.preferredName: Withdrawal by Subject Quality of Life Consent Knowledge Confirmed Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:Permission to do something.:The body of truths or facts accumulated in the course of time, the cumulated sum of information, its volume and nature, in any civilization, period, or country.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
The body of truths or facts accumulated in the course of time, the cumulated sum of information, its volume and nature, in any civilization, period, or country.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CRF Standards Initiative consent module.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 02.13.23_Set Reg Status to Standard for all CDISC Aligned content_ghd
